# Legal Research Memo (Updated)

## Summary
SaaS companies operating in California must adopt reasonable security measures under the CCPA and further encrypt data under the CPRA. Additionally, per Section 13.2 of the Cybersecurity Enforcement Act of 2024, any SaaS provider that processes more than 10,000 California consumer records must implement end‑to‑end encryption and undergo annual third‑party security audits. Failure to comply can result in statutory penalties and liability for consumer privacy breaches.

# Legal Research Memo (Updated)

## Summary
SaaS companies operating in California must adopt reasonable security measures under the CCPA and further encrypt data under the CPRA. Additionally, per Section 13.2 of the Cybersecurity Enforcement Act of 2024, any SaaS provider that processes more than 10,000 California consumer records must implement end‑to‑end encryption and undergo annual third‑party security audits. Failure to comply can result in statutory penalties and liability for consumer privacy breaches.
